article.title: Finite BRST Mapping in Higher Derivative Models

multiple_choice_question.text: This formula represents the Jacobian of functional measure under which transformation?\n\n  J[φ] = exp (±∫d⁴x Σ<sub>Φ</sub> (δΘ\'[φ(x)])/(δφ(x)) s<sub>b</sub>φ(x))

The given Jacobian, calculated from a specific field-dependent parameter, signifies the presence of what kind of terms in the context of Maxwell theory?\n\n  J[φ] =  exp (∫d⁴x [(1/M²)A<sup>μ</sup>∂<sub>μ</sub>c + (1/(2ξM²))B²c])
What does this equation represent in the context of higher-derivative gravity?\n\n  S<sub>gf</sub> = 1/2 ∫ d⁴x (□h<sub>μν</sub>)<sup>2</sup>
choices: A gauge-fixing term with higher derivatives
The interaction term between gravity and matter

multiple_choice_question.text:
These equations describe which type of transformation applied to higher-derivative gravity?

  δ<sub>b</sub>h<sub>μν</sub> = D<sub>μ</sub>ξ<sub>ν</sub>Θ[φ], δ<sub>b</sub>c<sup>μ</sup> = -ξ∂<sub>ν</sub>c<sup>μ</sup>c<sup>ν</sup>Λ Θ[φ], 
  δ<sub>b</sub>c̄<sub>μ</sub> = -B<sub>μ</sub>ΛΘ[φ] δ<sub>b</sub>B<sup>μ</sup> = 0.
